This section explains the app\'s behaviour and its various settings. For more information, enquiries or feature requests, write an email to the address provided below or via the \"Send feedback\" button.

Bamowi is observing your phone\'s battery health. Thus, a background task is required to run in order to monitor the battery\'s behaviour. It consumes very little of your battery, much less than 1\%. \nThe main purpose of Bamowi is to warn you if your phone\'s battery temperature is too low or too high. Furthermore, there is an accompanying widget which uses the same background process. This widget gives you an immediate visibility over your battery\'s current state. \nNote, it is not Bamowi\'s purpose to save or optimise your battery consumption. There are other apps for this.

Since Android Oreo (Android 8), Google changed the behaviour of notifications and background tasks (Android services). It is no longer possible to run an app in the background after it has been closed without giving the user a notification. This way, the user sees that the app is still running. Bamowi needs to run in the background, however, notifications can be switched off.

Make sure that the \"Temperature limit warning\" notification is not disabled. \nIf you have Android 7.1 or older, unfortunately it is not possible to disable single notifications, only all notifications. This means, if you disable the notifications, the temperature limit warnings are disabled too.

Some smartphone manufacturers modify the Android system to their needs and even violate Google\'s Android guidelines. They implement their own battery saver apps which shut down most apps in the background to save battery. \n\nSometimes, Bamowi is affected by this behaviour and gets closed. In such cases, the workaround is for you to manually change the settings of your smartphone. Try to change the Bamowi app launch battery settings from \"Auto-launch\" to \"Manually\".

This is not on all Android systems available. 

In addition, some manufacturers allow to whitelist apps so that they could be excluded from battery optimisation. 
Finally, make sure that the "Temperature limit warning" notification is not disabled.

Android gives you a warning that Bamowi is running in the background. This app runs a background service to observe the battery temperature, what is necessary to notify you about too low or too high temperature.
Notifies if the battery reaches a certain temperature limit. Set the limit in the app\'s settings.

It is recommended you disable battery optimisation for this app. This will prevent the Android OS to shut down the app unexpectedly. Bamowi can work reliably only if it remains active in the background. \n\nClick OK to proceed. From the filter drop-down select \"All apps\", choose Bamowi and set it to \"Not optimised\".
\n\nYou can always change this from the Bamowi settings menu.
